MetaStan 1.0.0

    • Conducting meta-analysis using MetaStan

Plot a dose-response plot

Source: R/plot.MBMA_stan.R
plot.MBMA_stan.Rd

Takes a MBMA_stan object which is obtained by function MBMA_stan and plot a dose-response plot, showing observed event probabilities and the estimated dose-response function with pointwise 95

# S3 method for MBMA_stan
plot(x = MBMA.stan, ...)

Arguments

x

A MBMA_stan object.
...

Further arguments passed to ggplot.

Source

This function uses ggplot function from ggplot2 R package.

Value

The return value is invisible NULL.

See also

ggplot2::ggplot

Author

Christian Roever and Burak Kuersad Guenhan

Examples

if (FALSE) {
## Load the dataset
data('dat.Eletriptan', package = "MetaStan")
## Fitting a Binomial-Normal Hierarchial model using WIP priors
datMBMA = create_MBMA_dat(dat = dat.Eletriptan,
                         armVars = c(dose = "d", r = "r",
                                     n = "n"),
                         nArmsVar = "nd")

MBMA.Emax  <- MBMA_stan(data = datMBMA,
                          family = "binomial",
                          dose_response = "emax",
                          Emax_prior = c(0, 10),
                          ED50_prior = "functional",
                          tau_prior_dist = "half-normal",
                          tau_prior = 0.5)
print(MBMA.Emax)
plot(MBMA.Emax)
# use ggplot2 package for further adjustments
Library(ggplot2)
theme_set(theme_classic())
plot(MBMA.Emax) + xlab("Doses (mg)") + ylab("response probabilities")

}
